00044 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_MDS

00051 static int osp_sync_id_traction_init(struct osp_device *d);
00052 static void osp_sync_id_traction_fini(struct osp_device *d);
00053 static __u32 osp_sync_id_get(struct osp_device *d, __u32 id);
00054 static void osp_sync_remove_from_tracker(struct osp_device *d);
00055 
00056 /*
00057  * this is a components of OSP implementing synchronization between MDS and OST
00058  * it llogs all interesting changes (currently it's uig/gid change and object
00059  * destroy) atomically, then makes sure changes hit OST storage
00060  *
00061  * we have 4 queues of work:
00062  *
00063  * the first queue is llog itself, once read a change is stored in 2nd queue
00064  * in form of RPC (but RPC isn't fired yet).
00065  *
00066  * the second queue (opd_syn_waiting_for_commit) holds changes awaiting local
00067  * commit. once change is committed locally it migrates onto 3rd queue.
00068  *
00069  * the third queue (opd_syn_committed_here) holds changes committed locally,
00070  * but not sent to OST (as the pipe can be full). once pipe becomes non-full
00071  * we take a change from the queue and fire corresponded RPC.
00072  *
00073  * once RPC is reported committed by OST (using regular last_committed mech.)
00074  * the change jumps into 4th queue (opd_syn_committed_there), now we can
00075  * cancel corresponded llog record and release RPC
00076  *
00077  * opd_syn_changes is a number of unread llog records (to be processed).
00078  * notice this number doesn't include llog records from previous boots.
00079  * with OSP_SYN_THRESHOLD we try to batch processing a bit (TO BE IMPLEMENTED)
00080  *
00081  * opd_syn_rpc_in_progress is a number of requests in 2-4 queues.
00082  * we control this with OSP_MAX_IN_PROGRESS so that OSP don't consume
00083  * too much memory -- how to deal with 1000th OSTs ? batching could help?
00084  *
00085  * opd_syn_rpc_in_flight is a number of RPC in flight.
00086  * we control this with OSP_MAX_IN_FLIGHT
00087  */
00088 
00089 /* XXX: do math to learn reasonable threshold
00090  * should it be ~ number of changes fitting bulk? */
00091 
00092 #define OSP_SYN_THRESHOLD       10
00093 #define OSP_MAX_IN_FLIGHT       8
00094 #define OSP_MAX_IN_PROGRESS     4096
00095 
00096 #define OSP_JOB_MAGIC           0x26112005
00097 
00098 struct osp_job_req_args {
00100         struct ptlrpc_replay_async_args jra_raa;
00101         struct list_head                jra_committed_link;
00102         struct list_head                jra_inflight_link;
00103         __u32                           jra_magic;
00104 };
00105 
00106 static inline int osp_sync_running(struct osp_device *d)
00107 {
00108         return !!(d->opd_syn_thread.t_flags & SVC_RUNNING);
00109 }
00110 
00119 static inline int osp_sync_stopped(struct osp_device *d)
00120 {
00121         return !!(d->opd_syn_thread.t_flags & SVC_STOPPED);
00122 }
00123 
00124 /*
00125  ** Check for new changes to sync
00126  *
00127  * \param[in] d         OSP device
00128  *
00129  * \retval 1            there are changes
00130  * \retval 0            there are no changes
00131  */
00132 static inline int osp_sync_has_new_job(struct osp_device *d)
00133 {
00134         return ((d->opd_syn_last_processed_id < d->opd_syn_last_used_id) &&
00135                 (d->opd_syn_last_processed_id < d->opd_syn_last_committed_id))
00136                 || (d->opd_syn_prev_done == 0);
00137 }
00138 
00139 static inline int osp_sync_inflight_conflict(struct osp_device *d,
00140                                              struct llog_rec_hdr *h)
00141 {
00142         struct osp_job_req_args *jra;
00143         struct ost_id            ostid;
00144         int                      conflict = 0;
00145 
00146         if (h == NULL || h->lrh_type == LLOG_GEN_REC ||
00147             list_empty(&d->opd_syn_inflight_list))
00148                 return conflict;
00149 
00150         memset(&ostid, 0, sizeof(ostid));
00151         switch (h->lrh_type) {
00152         case MDS_UNLINK_REC:
00153                 ostid_set_seq(&ostid, ((struct llog_unlink_rec *)h)->lur_oseq);
00154                 ostid_set_id(&ostid, ((struct llog_unlink_rec *)h)->lur_oid);
00155                 break;
00156         case MDS_UNLINK64_REC:
00157                 fid_to_ostid(&((struct llog_unlink64_rec *)h)->lur_fid, &ostid);
00158                 break;
00159         case MDS_SETATTR64_REC:
00160                 ostid = ((struct llog_setattr64_rec *)h)->lsr_oi;
00161                 break;
00162         default:
00163                 LBUG();
00164         }
00165 
00166         spin_lock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00167         list_for_each_entry(jra, &d->opd_syn_inflight_list, jra_inflight_link) {
00168                 struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00169                 struct ost_body         *body;
00170 
00171                 LASSERT(jra->jra_magic == OSP_JOB_MAGIC);
00172 
00173                 req = container_of((void *)jra, struct ptlrpc_request,
00174                                    rq_async_args);
00175                 body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill,
00176                                               &RMF_OST_BODY);
00177                 LASSERT(body);
00178 
00179                 if (memcmp(&ostid, &body->oa.o_oi, sizeof(ostid)) == 0) {
00180                         conflict = 1;
00181                         break;
00182                 }
00183         }
00184         spin_unlock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00185 
00186         return conflict;
00187 }
00188 
00189 static inline int osp_sync_low_in_progress(struct osp_device *d)
00190 {
00191         return d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress < d->opd_syn_max_rpc_in_progress;
00192 }
00193 
00202 static inline int osp_sync_low_in_flight(struct osp_device *d)
00203 {
00204         return d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight < d->opd_syn_max_rpc_in_flight;
00205 }
00206 
00215 static inline int osp_sync_has_work(struct osp_device *d)
00216 {
00217         /* has new/old changes and low in-progress? */
00218         if (osp_sync_has_new_job(d) && osp_sync_low_in_progress(d) &&
00219             osp_sync_low_in_flight(d) && d->opd_imp_connected)
00220                 return 1;
00221 
00222         /* has remotely committed? */
00223         if (!list_empty(&d->opd_syn_committed_there))
00224                 return 1;
00225 
00226         return 0;
00227 }
00228 
00229 #define osp_sync_check_for_work(d)                      \
00230 {                                                       \
00231         if (osp_sync_has_work(d)) {                     \
00232                 wake_up(&d->opd_syn_waitq);    \
00233         }                                               \
00234 }
00235 
00236 void __osp_sync_check_for_work(struct osp_device *d)
00237 {
00238         osp_sync_check_for_work(d);
00239 }
00240 
00255 static inline int osp_sync_can_process_new(struct osp_device *d,
00256                                            struct llog_rec_hdr *rec)
00257 {
00258         LASSERT(d);
00259 
00260         if (unlikely(atomic_read(&d->opd_syn_barrier) > 0))
00261                 return 0;
00262         if (unlikely(osp_sync_inflight_conflict(d, rec)))
00263                 return 0;
00264         if (!osp_sync_low_in_progress(d))
00265                 return 0;
00266         if (!osp_sync_low_in_flight(d))
00267                 return 0;
00268         if (!d->opd_imp_connected)
00269                 return 0;
00270         if (d->opd_syn_prev_done == 0)
00271                 return 1;
00272         if (d->opd_syn_changes == 0)
00273                 return 0;
00274         if (rec == NULL || rec->lrh_id <= d->opd_syn_last_committed_id)
00275                 return 1;
00276         return 0;
00277 }
00278 
00294 int osp_sync_declare_add(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_object *o,
00295                          llog_op_type type, struct thandle *th)
00296 {
00297         struct osp_thread_info  *osi = osp_env_info(env);
00298         struct osp_device       *d = lu2osp_dev(o->opo_obj.do_lu.lo_dev);
00299         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
00300         struct thandle          *storage_th;
00301         int                      rc;
00302 
00303         ENTRY;
00304 
00305         /* it's a layering violation, to access internals of th,
00306          * but we can do this as a sanity check, for a while */
00307         LASSERT(th->th_top != NULL);
00308         storage_th = thandle_get_sub_by_dt(env, th->th_top, d->opd_storage);
00309         if (IS_ERR(storage_th))
00310                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(storage_th));
00311 
00312         switch (type) {
00313         case MDS_UNLINK64_REC:
00314                 osi->osi_hdr.lrh_len = sizeof(struct llog_unlink64_rec);
00315                 break;
00316         case MDS_SETATTR64_REC:
00317                 osi->osi_hdr.lrh_len = sizeof(struct llog_setattr64_rec);
00318                 break;
00319         default:
00320                 LBUG();
00321         }
00322 
00323         /* we want ->dt_trans_start() to allocate per-thandle structure */
00324         storage_th->th_tags |= LCT_OSP_THREAD;
00325 
00326         ctxt = llog_get_context(d->opd_obd, LLOG_MDS_OST_ORIG_CTXT);
00327         LASSERT(ctxt);
00328 
00329         rc = llog_declare_add(env, ctxt->loc_handle, &osi->osi_hdr,
00330                               storage_th);
00331         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00332 
00333         RETURN(rc);
00334 }
00335 
00357 static int osp_sync_add_rec(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *d,
00358                             const struct lu_fid *fid, llog_op_type type,
00359                             int count, struct thandle *th,
00360                             const struct lu_attr *attr)
00361 {
00362         struct osp_thread_info  *osi = osp_env_info(env);
00363         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
00364         struct osp_txn_info     *txn;
00365         struct thandle          *storage_th;
00366         int                      rc;
00367 
00368         ENTRY;
00369 
00370         /* it's a layering violation, to access internals of th,
00371          * but we can do this as a sanity check, for a while */
00372         LASSERT(th->th_top != NULL);
00373         storage_th = thandle_get_sub_by_dt(env, th->th_top, d->opd_storage);
00374         if (IS_ERR(storage_th))
00375                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(storage_th));
00376 
00377         switch (type) {
00378         case MDS_UNLINK64_REC:
00379                 osi->osi_hdr.lrh_len = sizeof(osi->osi_unlink);
00380                 osi->osi_hdr.lrh_type = MDS_UNLINK64_REC;
00381                 osi->osi_unlink.lur_fid  = *fid;
00382                 osi->osi_unlink.lur_count = count;
00383                 break;
00384         case MDS_SETATTR64_REC:
00385                 rc = fid_to_ostid(fid, &osi->osi_oi);
00386                 LASSERT(rc == 0);
00387                 osi->osi_hdr.lrh_len = sizeof(osi->osi_setattr);
00388                 osi->osi_hdr.lrh_type = MDS_SETATTR64_REC;
00389                 osi->osi_setattr.lsr_oi  = osi->osi_oi;
00390                 LASSERT(attr);
00391                 osi->osi_setattr.lsr_uid = attr->la_uid;
00392                 osi->osi_setattr.lsr_gid = attr->la_gid;
00393                 osi->osi_setattr.lsr_valid =
00394                         ((attr->la_valid & LA_UID) ? OBD_MD_FLUID : 0) |
00395                         ((attr->la_valid & LA_GID) ? OBD_MD_FLGID : 0);
00396                 break;
00397         default:
00398                 LBUG();
00399         }
00400 
00401         txn = osp_txn_info(&storage_th->th_ctx);
00402         LASSERT(txn);
00403 
00404         txn->oti_current_id = osp_sync_id_get(d, txn->oti_current_id);
00405         osi->osi_hdr.lrh_id = txn->oti_current_id;
00406 
00407         ctxt = llog_get_context(d->opd_obd, LLOG_MDS_OST_ORIG_CTXT);
00408         if (ctxt == NULL)
00409                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00410 
00411         rc = llog_add(env, ctxt->loc_handle, &osi->osi_hdr, &osi->osi_cookie,
00412                       storage_th);
00413         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00414 
00415         if (likely(rc >= 0)) {
00416                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: new record "DOSTID":%lu/%lu: %d\n",
00417                        d->opd_obd->obd_name,
00418                        POSTID(&osi->osi_cookie.lgc_lgl.lgl_oi),
00419                        (unsigned long)osi->osi_cookie.lgc_lgl.lgl_ogen,
00420                        (unsigned long)osi->osi_cookie.lgc_index, rc);
00421                 spin_lock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00422                 d->opd_syn_changes++;
00423                 spin_unlock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00424         }
00425         /* return 0 always here, error case just cause no llog record */
00426         RETURN(0);
00427 }
00428 
00429 int osp_sync_add(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_object *o,
00430                  llog_op_type type, struct thandle *th,
00431                  const struct lu_attr *attr)
00432 {
00433         return osp_sync_add_rec(env, lu2osp_dev(o->opo_obj.do_lu.lo_dev),
00434                                 lu_object_fid(&o->opo_obj.do_lu), type, 1,
00435                                 th, attr);
00436 }
00437 
00438 int osp_sync_gap(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *d,
00439                         struct lu_fid *fid, int lost, struct thandle *th)
00440 {
00441         return osp_sync_add_rec(env, d, fid, MDS_UNLINK64_REC, lost, th, NULL);
00442 }
00443 
00444 /*
00445  * it's quite obvious we can't maintain all the structures in the memory:
00446  * while OST is down, MDS can be processing thousands and thousands of unlinks
00447  * filling persistent llogs and in-core respresentation
00448  *
00449  * this doesn't scale at all. so we need basically the following:
00450  * a) destroy/setattr append llog records
00451  * b) once llog has grown to X records, we process first Y committed records
00452  *
00453  *  once record R is found via llog_process(), it becomes committed after any
00454  *  subsequent commit callback (at the most)
00455  */
00456 
00470 static void osp_sync_request_commit_cb(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00471 {
00472         struct osp_device *d = req->rq_cb_data;
00473         struct osp_job_req_args *jra;
00474 
00475         CDEBUG(D_HA, "commit req %p, transno "LPU64"\n", req, req->rq_transno);
00476 
00477         if (unlikely(req->rq_transno == 0))
00478                 return;
00479 
00480         /* do not do any opd_dyn_rpc_* accounting here
00481          * it's done in osp_sync_interpret sooner or later */
00482         LASSERT(d);
00483 
00484         jra = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
00485         LASSERT(jra->jra_magic == OSP_JOB_MAGIC);
00486         LASSERT(list_empty(&jra->jra_committed_link));
00487 
00488         ptlrpc_request_addref(req);
00489 
00490         spin_lock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00491         list_add(&jra->jra_committed_link, &d->opd_syn_committed_there);
00492         spin_unlock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00493 
00494         /* XXX: some batching wouldn't hurt */
00495         wake_up(&d->opd_syn_waitq);
00496 }
00497 
00515 static int osp_sync_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
00516                               struct ptlrpc_request *req, void *aa, int rc)
00517 {
00518         struct osp_device *d = req->rq_cb_data;
00519         struct osp_job_req_args *jra = aa;
00520 
00521         if (jra->jra_magic != OSP_JOB_MAGIC) {
00522                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "bad magic %u\n", jra->jra_magic);
00523                 LBUG();
00524         }
00525         LASSERT(d);
00526 
00527         CDEBUG(D_HA, "reply req %p/%d, rc %d, transno %u\n", req,
00528                atomic_read(&req->rq_refcount),
00529                rc, (unsigned) req->rq_transno);
00530         LASSERT(rc || req->rq_transno);
00531 
00532         if (rc == -ENOENT) {
00533                 /*
00534                  * we tried to destroy object or update attributes,
00535                  * but object doesn't exist anymore - cancell llog record
00536                  */
00537                 LASSERT(req->rq_transno == 0);
00538                 LASSERT(list_empty(&jra->jra_committed_link));
00539 
00540                 ptlrpc_request_addref(req);
00541 
00542                 spin_lock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00543                 list_add(&jra->jra_committed_link, &d->opd_syn_committed_there);
00544                 spin_unlock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00545 
00546                 wake_up(&d->opd_syn_waitq);
00547         } else if (rc) {
00548                 struct obd_import *imp = req->rq_import;
00549                 /*
00550                  * error happened, we'll try to repeat on next boot ?
00551                  */
00552                 LASSERTF(req->rq_transno == 0 ||
00553                          req->rq_import_generation < imp->imp_generation,
00554                          "transno "LPU64", rc %d, gen: req %d, imp %d\n",
00555                          req->rq_transno, rc, req->rq_import_generation,
00556                          imp->imp_generation);
00557                 if (req->rq_transno == 0) {
00558                         /* this is the last time we see the request
00559                          * if transno is not zero, then commit cb
00560                          * will be called at some point */
00561                         LASSERT(d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress > 0);
00562                         spin_lock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00563                         d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress--;
00564                         spin_unlock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00565                 }
00566 
00567                 wake_up(&d->opd_syn_waitq);
00568         } else if (d->opd_pre != NULL &&
00569                    unlikely(d->opd_pre_status == -ENOSPC)) {
00570                 /*
00571                  * if current status is -ENOSPC (lack of free space on OST)
00572                  * then we should poll OST immediately once object destroy
00573                  * is replied
00574                  */
00575                 osp_statfs_need_now(d);
00576         }
00577 
00578         LASSERT(d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight > 0);
00579         spin_lock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00580         d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight--;
00581         list_del_init(&jra->jra_inflight_link);
00582         spin_unlock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00583         if (unlikely(atomic_read(&d->opd_syn_barrier) > 0))
00584                 wake_up(&d->opd_syn_barrier_waitq);
00585         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: %d in flight, %d in progress\n",
00586                d->opd_obd->obd_name, d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight,
00587                d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress);
00588 
00589         osp_sync_check_for_work(d);
00590 
00591         return 0;
00592 }
00593 
00594 /*
00595  ** Add request to ptlrpc queue.
00596  *
00597  * This is just a tiny helper function to put the request on the sending list
00598  *
00599  * \param[in] d         OSP device
00600  * \param[in] req       request
00601  */
00602 static void osp_sync_send_new_rpc(struct osp_device *d,
00603                                   struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00604 {
00605         struct osp_job_req_args *jra;
00606 
00607         LASSERT(d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight <= d->opd_syn_max_rpc_in_flight);
00608 
00609         jra = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
00610         jra->jra_magic = OSP_JOB_MAGIC;
00611         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&jra->jra_committed_link);
00612         spin_lock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00613         list_add_tail(&jra->jra_inflight_link, &d->opd_syn_inflight_list);
00614         spin_unlock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00615 
00616         ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
00617 }
00618 
00619 
00637 static struct ptlrpc_request *osp_sync_new_job(struct osp_device *d,
00638                                                struct llog_handle *llh,
00639                                                struct llog_rec_hdr *h,
00640                                                ost_cmd_t op,
00641                                                const struct req_format *format)
00642 {
00643         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00644         struct ost_body         *body;
00645         struct obd_import       *imp;
00646         int                      rc;
00647 
00648         /* Prepare the request */
00649         imp = d->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00650         LASSERT(imp);
00651 
00652         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSP_CHECK_ENOMEM))
00653                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00654 
00655         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, format);
00656         if (req == NULL)
00657                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00658 
00659         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, op);
00660         if (rc) {
00661                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00662                 return ERR_PTR(rc);
00663         }
00664 
00665         /*
00666          * this is a trick: to save on memory allocations we put cookie
00667          * into the request, but don't set corresponded flag in o_valid
00668          * so that OST doesn't interpret this cookie. once the request
00669          * is committed on OST we take cookie from the request and cancel
00670          */
00671         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00672         LASSERT(body);
00673         body->oa.o_lcookie.lgc_lgl = llh->lgh_id;
00674         body->oa.o_lcookie.lgc_subsys = LLOG_MDS_OST_ORIG_CTXT;
00675         body->oa.o_lcookie.lgc_index = h->lrh_index;
00676 
00677         req->rq_interpret_reply = osp_sync_interpret;
00678         req->rq_commit_cb = osp_sync_request_commit_cb;
00679         req->rq_cb_data = d;
00680 
00681         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00682 
00683         return req;
00684 }
00685 
00700 static int osp_sync_new_setattr_job(struct osp_device *d,
00701                                     struct llog_handle *llh,
00702                                     struct llog_rec_hdr *h)
00703 {
00704         struct llog_setattr64_rec       *rec = (struct llog_setattr64_rec *)h;
00705         struct ptlrpc_request           *req;
00706         struct ost_body                 *body;
00707 
00708         ENTRY;
00709         LASSERT(h->lrh_type == MDS_SETATTR64_REC);
00710 
00711         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSP_CHECK_INVALID_REC))
00712                 RETURN(1);
00713         /* lsr_valid can only be 0 or have OBD_MD_{FLUID,FLGID} set,
00714          * so no bits other than these should be set. */
00715         if ((rec->lsr_valid & ~(OBD_MD_FLUID | OBD_MD_FLGID)) != 0) {
00716                 CERROR("%s: invalid setattr record, lsr_valid:"LPU64"\n",
00717                        d->opd_obd->obd_name, rec->lsr_valid);
00718                 /* return 1 on invalid record */
00719                 RETURN(1);
00720         }
00721 
00722         req = osp_sync_new_job(d, llh, h, OST_SETATTR, &RQF_OST_SETATTR);
00723         if (IS_ERR(req))
00724                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(req));
00725 
00726         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00727         LASSERT(body);
00728         body->oa.o_oi = rec->lsr_oi;
00729         body->oa.o_uid = rec->lsr_uid;
00730         body->oa.o_gid = rec->lsr_gid;
00731         body->oa.o_valid = OBD_MD_FLGROUP | OBD_MD_FLID;
00732         /* old setattr record (prior 2.6.0) doesn't have 'valid' stored,
00733          * we assume that both UID and GID are valid in that case. */
00734         if (rec->lsr_valid == 0)
00735                 body->oa.o_valid |= (OBD_MD_FLUID | OBD_MD_FLGID);
00736         else
00737                 body->oa.o_valid |= rec->lsr_valid;
00738 
00739         osp_sync_send_new_rpc(d, req);
00740         RETURN(0);
00741 }
00742 
00758 static int osp_sync_new_unlink_job(struct osp_device *d,
00759                                    struct llog_handle *llh,
00760                                    struct llog_rec_hdr *h)
00761 {
00762         struct llog_unlink_rec  *rec = (struct llog_unlink_rec *)h;
00763         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00764         struct ost_body         *body;
00765 
00766         ENTRY;
00767         LASSERT(h->lrh_type == MDS_UNLINK_REC);
00768 
00769         req = osp_sync_new_job(d, llh, h, OST_DESTROY, &RQF_OST_DESTROY);
00770         if (IS_ERR(req))
00771                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(req));
00772 
00773         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00774         LASSERT(body);
00775         ostid_set_seq(&body->oa.o_oi, rec->lur_oseq);
00776         ostid_set_id(&body->oa.o_oi, rec->lur_oid);
00777         body->oa.o_misc = rec->lur_count;
00778         body->oa.o_valid = OBD_MD_FLGROUP | OBD_MD_FLID;
00779         if (rec->lur_count)
00780                 body->oa.o_valid |= OBD_MD_FLOBJCOUNT;
00781 
00782         osp_sync_send_new_rpc(d, req);
00783         RETURN(0);
00784 }
00785 
00804 static int osp_sync_new_unlink64_job(struct osp_device *d,
00805                                      struct llog_handle *llh,
00806                                      struct llog_rec_hdr *h)
00807 {
00808         struct llog_unlink64_rec        *rec = (struct llog_unlink64_rec *)h;
00809         struct ptlrpc_request           *req = NULL;
00810         struct ost_body                 *body;
00811         int                              rc;
00812 
00813         ENTRY;
00814         LASSERT(h->lrh_type == MDS_UNLINK64_REC);
00815         req = osp_sync_new_job(d, llh, h, OST_DESTROY,
00816                                &RQF_OST_DESTROY);
00817         if (IS_ERR(req))
00818                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(req));
00819 
00820         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00821         if (body == NULL)
00822                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
00823         rc = fid_to_ostid(&rec->lur_fid, &body->oa.o_oi);
00824         if (rc < 0)
00825                 RETURN(rc);
00826         body->oa.o_misc = rec->lur_count;
00827         body->oa.o_valid = OBD_MD_FLGROUP | OBD_MD_FLID |
00828                            OBD_MD_FLOBJCOUNT;
00829         osp_sync_send_new_rpc(d, req);
00830         RETURN(0);
00831 }
00832 
00849 static void osp_sync_process_record(const struct lu_env *env,
00850                                     struct osp_device *d,
00851                                     struct llog_handle *llh,
00852                                     struct llog_rec_hdr *rec)
00853 {
00854         struct llog_handle      *cathandle = llh->u.phd.phd_cat_handle;
00855         struct llog_cookie       cookie;
00856         int                      rc = 0;
00857 
00858         ENTRY;
00859 
00860         cookie.lgc_lgl = llh->lgh_id;
00861         cookie.lgc_subsys = LLOG_MDS_OST_ORIG_CTXT;
00862         cookie.lgc_index = rec->lrh_index;
00863 
00864         if (unlikely(rec->lrh_type == LLOG_GEN_REC)) {
00865                 struct llog_gen_rec *gen = (struct llog_gen_rec *)rec;
00866 
00867                 /* we're waiting for the record generated by this instance */
00868                 LASSERT(d->opd_syn_prev_done == 0);
00869                 if (!memcmp(&d->opd_syn_generation, &gen->lgr_gen,
00870                             sizeof(gen->lgr_gen))) {
00871                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "processed all old entries\n");
00872                         d->opd_syn_prev_done = 1;
00873                 }
00874 
00875                 /* cancel any generation record */
00876                 rc = llog_cat_cancel_records(env, cathandle, 1, &cookie);
00877 
00878                 RETURN_EXIT;
00879         }
00880 
00881         /*
00882          * now we prepare and fill requests to OST, put them on the queue
00883          * and fire after next commit callback
00884          */
00885 
00886         /* notice we increment counters before sending RPC, to be consistent
00887          * in RPC interpret callback which may happen very quickly */
00888         spin_lock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00889         d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight++;
00890         d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress++;
00891         spin_unlock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00892 
00893         switch (rec->lrh_type) {
00894         /* case MDS_UNLINK_REC is kept for compatibility */
00895         case MDS_UNLINK_REC:
00896                 rc = osp_sync_new_unlink_job(d, llh, rec);
00897                 break;
00898         case MDS_UNLINK64_REC:
00899                 rc = osp_sync_new_unlink64_job(d, llh, rec);
00900                 break;
00901         case MDS_SETATTR64_REC:
00902                 rc = osp_sync_new_setattr_job(d, llh, rec);
00903                 break;
00904         default:
00905                 CERROR("%s: unknown record type: %x\n", d->opd_obd->obd_name,
00906                        rec->lrh_type);
00907                 /* treat "unknown record type" as "invalid" */
00908                 rc = 1;
00909                 break;
00910         }
00911 
00912         spin_lock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00913 
00914         /* For all kinds of records, not matter successful or not,
00915          * we should decrease changes and bump last_processed_id.
00916          */
00917         if (d->opd_syn_prev_done) {
00918                 LASSERT(d->opd_syn_changes > 0);
00919                 LASSERT(rec->lrh_id <= d->opd_syn_last_committed_id);
00920                 /* NOTE: it's possible to meet same id if
00921                  * OST stores few stripes of same file
00922                  */
00923                 if (rec->lrh_id > d->opd_syn_last_processed_id) {
00924                         d->opd_syn_last_processed_id = rec->lrh_id;
00925                         wake_up(&d->opd_syn_barrier_waitq);
00926                 }
00927                 d->opd_syn_changes--;
00928         }
00929         if (rc != 0) {
00930                 d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight--;
00931                 d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress--;
00932         }
00933         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: %d in flight, %d in progress\n",
00934                d->opd_obd->obd_name, d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight,
00935                d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress);
00936 
00937         spin_unlock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
00938 
00939         /* Delete the invalid record */
00940         if (rc == 1) {
00941                 rc = llog_cat_cancel_records(env, cathandle, 1, &cookie);
00942                 if (rc != 0)
00943                         CERROR("%s: can't delete invalid record: "
00944                                "fid = "DFID", rec_id = %u, rc = %d\n",
00945                                d->opd_obd->obd_name,
00946                                PFID(lu_object_fid(&cathandle->lgh_obj->do_lu)),
00947                                rec->lrh_id, rc);
00948         }
00949 
00950         CDEBUG(D_HA, "found record %x, %d, idx %u, id %u\n",
00951                rec->lrh_type, rec->lrh_len, rec->lrh_index, rec->lrh_id);
00952 
00953         RETURN_EXIT;
00954 }
00955 
00966 static void osp_sync_process_committed(const struct lu_env *env,
00967                                        struct osp_device *d)
00968 {
00969         struct obd_device       *obd = d->opd_obd;
00970         struct obd_import       *imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00971         struct ost_body         *body;
00972         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00973         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
00974         struct llog_handle      *llh;
00975         struct list_head         list;
00976         int                      rc, done = 0;
00977 
00978         ENTRY;
00979 
00980         if (list_empty(&d->opd_syn_committed_there))
00981                 return;
00982 
00983         /*
00984          * if current status is -ENOSPC (lack of free space on OST)
00985          * then we should poll OST immediately once object destroy
00986          * is committed.
00987          * notice: we do this upon commit as well because some backends
00988          * (like DMU) do not release space right away.
00989          */
00990         if (d->opd_pre != NULL && unlikely(d->opd_pre_status == -ENOSPC))
00991                 osp_statfs_need_now(d);
00992 
00993         /*
00994          * now cancel them all
00995          * XXX: can we improve this using some batching?
00996          *      with batch RPC that'll happen automatically?
00997          * XXX: can we store ctxt in lod_device and save few cycles ?
00998          */
00999         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_MDS_OST_ORIG_CTXT);
01000         LASSERT(ctxt);
01001 
01002         llh = ctxt->loc_handle;
01003         LASSERT(llh);
01004 
01005         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&list);
01006         spin_lock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
01007         list_splice(&d->opd_syn_committed_there, &list);
01008         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&d->opd_syn_committed_there);
01009         spin_unlock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
01010 
01011         while (!list_empty(&list)) {
01012                 struct osp_job_req_args *jra;
01013 
01014                 jra = list_entry(list.next, struct osp_job_req_args,
01015                                  jra_committed_link);
01016                 LASSERT(jra->jra_magic == OSP_JOB_MAGIC);
01017                 list_del_init(&jra->jra_committed_link);
01018 
01019                 req = container_of((void *)jra, struct ptlrpc_request,
01020                                    rq_async_args);
01021                 body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill,
01022                                               &RMF_OST_BODY);
01023                 LASSERT(body);
01024                 /* import can be closing, thus all commit cb's are
01025                  * called we can check committness directly */
01026                 if (req->rq_import_generation == imp->imp_generation) {
01027                         rc = llog_cat_cancel_records(env, llh, 1,
01028                                                      &body->oa.o_lcookie);
01029                         if (rc)
01030                                 CERROR("%s: can't cancel record: %d\n",
01031                                        obd->obd_name, rc);
01032                 } else {
01033                         DEBUG_REQ(D_OTHER, req, "imp_committed = "LPU64,
01034                                   imp->imp_peer_committed_transno);
01035                 }
01036                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01037                 done++;
01038         }
01039 
01040         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01041 
01042         LASSERT(d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress >= done);
01043         spin_lock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
01044         d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress -= done;
01045         spin_unlock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
01046         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: %d in flight, %d in progress\n",
01047                d->opd_obd->obd_name, d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight,
01048                d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress);
01049 
01050         osp_sync_check_for_work(d);
01051 
01052         /* wake up the thread if requested to stop:
01053          * it might be waiting for in-progress to complete */
01054         if (unlikely(osp_sync_running(d) == 0))
01055                 wake_up(&d->opd_syn_waitq);
01056 
01057         EXIT;
01058 }
01059 
01076 static int osp_sync_process_queues(const struct lu_env *env,
01077                                    struct llog_handle *llh,
01078                                    struct llog_rec_hdr *rec,
01079                                    void *data)
01080 {
01081         struct osp_device       *d = data;
01082 
01083         do {
01084                 struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
01085 
01086                 if (!osp_sync_running(d)) {
01087                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "stop llog processing\n");
01088                         return LLOG_PROC_BREAK;
01089                 }
01090 
01091                 /* process requests committed by OST */
01092                 osp_sync_process_committed(env, d);
01093 
01094                 /* if we there are changes to be processed and we have
01095                  * resources for this ... do now */
01096                 if (osp_sync_can_process_new(d, rec)) {
01097                         if (llh == NULL) {
01098                                 /* ask llog for another record */
01099                                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%lu changes, %u in progress,"
01100                                        " %u in flight\n",
01101                                        d->opd_syn_changes,
01102                                        d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress,
01103                                        d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight);
01104                                 return 0;
01105                         }
01106                         osp_sync_process_record(env, d, llh, rec);
01107                         llh = NULL;
01108                         rec = NULL;
01109                 }
01110 
01111                 if (d->opd_syn_last_processed_id == d->opd_syn_last_used_id)
01112                         osp_sync_remove_from_tracker(d);
01113 
01114                 l_wait_event(d->opd_syn_waitq,
01115                              !osp_sync_running(d) ||
01116                              osp_sync_can_process_new(d, rec) ||
01117                              !list_empty(&d->opd_syn_committed_there),
01118                              &lwi);
01119         } while (1);
01120 }
01121 
01142 static int osp_sync_thread(void *_arg)
01143 {
01144         struct osp_device       *d = _arg;
01145         struct ptlrpc_thread    *thread = &d->opd_syn_thread;
01146         struct l_wait_info       lwi = { 0 };
01147         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
01148         struct obd_device       *obd = d->opd_obd;
01149         struct llog_handle      *llh;
01150         struct lu_env            env;
01151         int                      rc, count;
01152 
01153         ENTRY;
01154 
01155         rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_LOCAL);
01156         if (rc) {
01157                 CERROR("%s: can't initialize env: rc = %d\n",
01158                        obd->obd_name, rc);
01159                 RETURN(rc);
01160         }
01161 
01162         spin_lock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
01163         thread->t_flags = SVC_RUNNING;
01164         spin_unlock(&d->opd_syn_lock);
01165         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01166 
01167         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_MDS_OST_ORIG_CTXT);
01168         if (ctxt == NULL) {
01169                 CERROR("can't get appropriate context\n");
01170                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01171         }
01172 
01173         llh = ctxt->loc_handle;
01174         if (llh == NULL) {
01175                 CERROR("can't get llh\n");
01176                 llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01177                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01178         }
01179 
01180         rc = llog_cat_process(&env, llh, osp_sync_process_queues, d, 0, 0);
01181         LASSERTF(rc == 0 || rc == LLOG_PROC_BREAK,
01182                  "%lu changes, %u in progress, %u in flight: %d\n",
01183                  d->opd_syn_changes, d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress,
01184                  d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight, rc);
01185 
01186         /* we don't expect llog_process_thread() to exit till umount */
01187         LASSERTF(thread->t_flags != SVC_RUNNING,
01188                  "%lu changes, %u in progress, %u in flight\n",
01189                  d->opd_syn_changes, d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress,
01190                  d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight);
01191 
01192         /* wait till all the requests are completed */
01193         count = 0;
01194         while (d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress > 0) {
01195                 osp_sync_process_committed(&env, d);
01196 
01197                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(cfs_time_seconds(5), NULL, NULL);
01198                 rc = l_wait_event(d->opd_syn_waitq,
01199                                   d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress == 0,
01200                                   &lwi);
01201                 if (rc == -ETIMEDOUT)
01202                         count++;
01203                 LASSERTF(count < 10, "%s: %d %d %sempty\n",
01204                          d->opd_obd->obd_name, d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress,
01205                          d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight,
01206                          list_empty(&d->opd_syn_committed_there) ? "" : "!");
01207 
01208         }
01209 
01210         llog_cat_close(&env, llh);
01211         rc = llog_cleanup(&env, ctxt);
01212         if (rc)
01213                 CERROR("can't cleanup llog: %d\n", rc);
01214 out:
01215         LASSERTF(d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress == 0,
01216                  "%s: %d %d %sempty\n",
01217                  d->opd_obd->obd_name, d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress,
01218                  d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight,
01219                  list_empty(&d->opd_syn_committed_there) ? "" : "!");
01220 
01221         thread->t_flags = SVC_STOPPED;
01222 
01223         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01224 
01225         lu_env_fini(&env);
01226 
01227         RETURN(0);
01228 }
01229 
01244 static int osp_sync_llog_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *d)
01245 {
01246         struct osp_thread_info  *osi = osp_env_info(env);
01247         struct lu_fid           *fid = &osi->osi_fid;
01248         struct llog_handle      *lgh = NULL;
01249         struct obd_device       *obd = d->opd_obd;
01250         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
01251         int                     rc;
01252 
01253         ENTRY;
01254 
01255         LASSERT(obd);
01256 
01257         /*
01258          * open llog corresponding to our OST
01259          */
01260         OBD_SET_CTXT_MAGIC(&obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt);
01261         obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt.dt = d->opd_storage;
01262 
01263         lu_local_obj_fid(fid, LLOG_CATALOGS_OID);
01264 
01265         rc = llog_osd_get_cat_list(env, d->opd_storage, d->opd_index, 1,
01266                                    &osi->osi_cid, fid);
01267         if (rc < 0) {
01268                 if (rc != -EFAULT) {
01269                         CERROR("%s: can't get id from catalogs: rc = %d\n",
01270                                obd->obd_name, rc);
01271                         RETURN(rc);
01272                 }
01273 
01274                 /* After sparse OST indices is supported, the CATALOG file
01275                  * may become a sparse file that results in failure on
01276                  * reading. Skip this error as the llog will be created
01277                  * later */
01278                 memset(&osi->osi_cid, 0, sizeof(osi->osi_cid));
01279                 rc = 0;
01280         }
01281 
01282         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: Init llog for %d - catid "DOSTID":%x\n",
01283                obd->obd_name, d->opd_index,
01284                POSTID(&osi->osi_cid.lci_logid.lgl_oi),
01285                osi->osi_cid.lci_logid.lgl_ogen);
01286 
01287         rc = llog_setup(env, obd, &obd->obd_olg, LLOG_MDS_OST_ORIG_CTXT,
01288                         d->opd_storage->dd_lu_dev.ld_obd,
01289                         &osp_mds_ost_orig_logops);
01290         if (rc)
01291                 RETURN(rc);
01292 
01293         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_MDS_OST_ORIG_CTXT);
01294         LASSERT(ctxt);
01295 
01296         if (likely(logid_id(&osi->osi_cid.lci_logid) != 0)) {
01297                 rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, &lgh, &osi->osi_cid.lci_logid, NULL,
01298                                LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
01299                 /* re-create llog if it is missing */
01300                 if (rc == -ENOENT)
01301                         logid_set_id(&osi->osi_cid.lci_logid, 0);
01302                 else if (rc < 0)
01303                         GOTO(out_cleanup, rc);
01304         }
01305 
01306         if (unlikely(logid_id(&osi->osi_cid.lci_logid) == 0)) {
01307                 rc = llog_open_create(env, ctxt, &lgh, NULL, NULL);
01308                 if (rc < 0)
01309                         GOTO(out_cleanup, rc);
01310                 osi->osi_cid.lci_logid = lgh->lgh_id;
01311         }
01312 
01313         LASSERT(lgh != NULL);
01314         ctxt->loc_handle = lgh;
01315 
01316         rc = llog_init_handle(env, lgh, LLOG_F_IS_CAT, NULL);
01317         if (rc)
01318                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01319 
01320         rc = llog_osd_put_cat_list(env, d->opd_storage, d->opd_index, 1,
01321                                    &osi->osi_cid, fid);
01322         if (rc)
01323                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01324 
01325         /*
01326          * put a mark in the llog till which we'll be processing
01327          * old records restless
01328          */
01329         d->opd_syn_generation.mnt_cnt = cfs_time_current();
01330         d->opd_syn_generation.conn_cnt = cfs_time_current();
01331 
01332         osi->osi_hdr.lrh_type = LLOG_GEN_REC;
01333         osi->osi_hdr.lrh_len = sizeof(osi->osi_gen);
01334 
01335         memcpy(&osi->osi_gen.lgr_gen, &d->opd_syn_generation,
01336                sizeof(osi->osi_gen.lgr_gen));
01337 
01338         rc = llog_cat_add(env, lgh, &osi->osi_gen.lgr_hdr, &osi->osi_cookie);
01339         if (rc < 0)
01340                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01341         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01342         RETURN(0);
01343 out_close:
01344         llog_cat_close(env, lgh);
01345 out_cleanup:
01346         llog_cleanup(env, ctxt);
01347         RETURN(rc);
01348 }
01349 
01359 static void osp_sync_llog_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *d)
01360 {
01361         struct llog_ctxt *ctxt;
01362 
01363         ctxt = llog_get_context(d->opd_obd, LLOG_MDS_OST_ORIG_CTXT);
01364         if (ctxt != NULL)
01365                 llog_cat_close(env, ctxt->loc_handle);
01366         llog_cleanup(env, ctxt);
01367 }
01368 
01381 int osp_sync_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *d)
01382 {
01383         struct l_wait_info       lwi = { 0 };
01384         struct task_struct      *task;
01385         int                      rc;
01386 
01387         ENTRY;
01388 
01389         rc = osp_sync_id_traction_init(d);
01390         if (rc)
01391                 RETURN(rc);
01392 
01393         /*
01394          * initialize llog storing changes
01395          */
01396         rc = osp_sync_llog_init(env, d);
01397         if (rc) {
01398                 CERROR("%s: can't initialize llog: rc = %d\n",
01399                        d->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
01400                 GOTO(err_id, rc);
01401         }
01402 
01403         /*
01404          * Start synchronization thread
01405          */
01406         d->opd_syn_max_rpc_in_flight = OSP_MAX_IN_FLIGHT;
01407         d->opd_syn_max_rpc_in_progress = OSP_MAX_IN_PROGRESS;
01408         spin_lock_init(&d->opd_syn_lock);
01409         init_waitqueue_head(&d->opd_syn_waitq);
01410         init_waitqueue_head(&d->opd_syn_barrier_waitq);
01411         init_waitqueue_head(&d->opd_syn_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
01412         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&d->opd_syn_inflight_list);
01413         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&d->opd_syn_committed_there);
01414 
01415         task = kthread_run(osp_sync_thread, d, "osp-syn-%u-%u",
01416                            d->opd_index, d->opd_group);
01417         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
01418                 rc = PTR_ERR(task);
01419                 CERROR("%s: cannot start sync thread: rc = %d\n",
01420                        d->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
01421                 GOTO(err_llog, rc);
01422         }
01423 
01424         l_wait_event(d->opd_syn_thread.t_ctl_waitq,
01425                      osp_sync_running(d) || osp_sync_stopped(d), &lwi);
01426 
01427         RETURN(0);
01428 err_llog:
01429         osp_sync_llog_fini(env, d);
01430 err_id:
01431         osp_sync_id_traction_fini(d);
01432         return rc;
01433 }
01434 
01444 int osp_sync_fini(struct osp_device *d)
01445 {
01446         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread = &d->opd_syn_thread;
01447 
01448         ENTRY;
01449 
01450         thread->t_flags = SVC_STOPPING;
01451         wake_up(&d->opd_syn_waitq);
01452         wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq, thread->t_flags & SVC_STOPPED);
01453 
01454         /*
01455          * unregister transaction callbacks only when sync thread
01456          * has finished operations with llog
01457          */
01458         osp_sync_id_traction_fini(d);
01459 
01460         RETURN(0);
01461 }
01462 
01463 static DEFINE_MUTEX(osp_id_tracker_sem);
01464 static struct list_head osp_id_tracker_list =
01465                 LIST_HEAD_INIT(osp_id_tracker_list);
01466 
01476 static void osp_sync_tracker_commit_cb(struct thandle *th, void *cookie)
01477 {
01478         struct osp_id_tracker   *tr = cookie;
01479         struct osp_device       *d;
01480         struct osp_txn_info     *txn;
01481 
01482         LASSERT(tr);
01483 
01484         txn = osp_txn_info(&th->th_ctx);
01485         if (txn == NULL || txn->oti_current_id < tr->otr_committed_id)
01486                 return;
01487 
01488         spin_lock(&tr->otr_lock);
01489         if (likely(txn->oti_current_id > tr->otr_committed_id)) {
01490                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "committed: %u -> %u\n",
01491                        tr->otr_committed_id, txn->oti_current_id);
01492                 tr->otr_committed_id = txn->oti_current_id;
01493 
01494                 list_for_each_entry(d, &tr->otr_wakeup_list,
01495                                     opd_syn_ontrack) {
01496                         d->opd_syn_last_committed_id = tr->otr_committed_id;
01497                         wake_up(&d->opd_syn_waitq);
01498                 }
01499         }
01500         spin_unlock(&tr->otr_lock);
01501 }
01502 
01522 static int osp_sync_id_traction_init(struct osp_device *d)
01523 {
01524         struct osp_id_tracker   *tr, *found = NULL;
01525         int                      rc = 0;
01526 
01527         LASSERT(d);
01528         LASSERT(d->opd_storage);
01529         LASSERT(d->opd_syn_tracker == NULL);
01530         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&d->opd_syn_ontrack);
01531 
01532         mutex_lock(&osp_id_tracker_sem);
01533         list_for_each_entry(tr, &osp_id_tracker_list, otr_list) {
01534                 if (tr->otr_dev == d->opd_storage) {
01535                         LASSERT(atomic_read(&tr->otr_refcount));
01536                         atomic_inc(&tr->otr_refcount);
01537                         d->opd_syn_tracker = tr;
01538                         found = tr;
01539                         break;
01540                 }
01541         }
01542 
01543         if (found == NULL) {
01544                 rc = -ENOMEM;
01545                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(tr);
01546                 if (tr) {
01547                         d->opd_syn_tracker = tr;
01548                         spin_lock_init(&tr->otr_lock);
01549                         tr->otr_dev = d->opd_storage;
01550                         tr->otr_next_id = 1;
01551                         tr->otr_committed_id = 0;
01552                         atomic_set(&tr->otr_refcount, 1);
01553                         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tr->otr_wakeup_list);
01554                         list_add(&tr->otr_list, &osp_id_tracker_list);
01555                         tr->otr_tx_cb.dtc_txn_commit =
01556                                                 osp_sync_tracker_commit_cb;
01557                         tr->otr_tx_cb.dtc_cookie = tr;
01558                         tr->otr_tx_cb.dtc_tag = LCT_MD_THREAD;
01559                         dt_txn_callback_add(d->opd_storage, &tr->otr_tx_cb);
01560                         rc = 0;
01561                 }
01562         }
01563         mutex_unlock(&osp_id_tracker_sem);
01564 
01565         return rc;
01566 }
01567 
01576 static void osp_sync_id_traction_fini(struct osp_device *d)
01577 {
01578         struct osp_id_tracker *tr;
01579 
01580         ENTRY;
01581 
01582         LASSERT(d);
01583         tr = d->opd_syn_tracker;
01584         if (tr == NULL) {
01585                 EXIT;
01586                 return;
01587         }
01588 
01589         osp_sync_remove_from_tracker(d);
01590 
01591         mutex_lock(&osp_id_tracker_sem);
01592         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&tr->otr_refcount)) {
01593                 dt_txn_callback_del(d->opd_storage, &tr->otr_tx_cb);
01594                 LASSERT(list_empty(&tr->otr_wakeup_list));
01595                 list_del(&tr->otr_list);
01596                 OBD_FREE_PTR(tr);
01597                 d->opd_syn_tracker = NULL;
01598         }
01599         mutex_unlock(&osp_id_tracker_sem);
01600 
01601         EXIT;
01602 }
01603 
01617 static __u32 osp_sync_id_get(struct osp_device *d, __u32 id)
01618 {
01619         struct osp_id_tracker *tr;
01620 
01621         tr = d->opd_syn_tracker;
01622         LASSERT(tr);
01623 
01624         /* XXX: we can improve this introducing per-cpu preallocated ids? */
01625         spin_lock(&tr->otr_lock);
01626         if (unlikely(tr->otr_next_id <= d->opd_syn_last_used_id)) {
01627                 spin_unlock(&tr->otr_lock);
01628                 CERROR("%s: next %u, last synced %lu\n",
01629                        d->opd_obd->obd_name, tr->otr_next_id,
01630                        d->opd_syn_last_used_id);
01631                 LBUG();
01632         }
01633 
01634         if (id == 0)
01635                 id = tr->otr_next_id++;
01636         if (id > d->opd_syn_last_used_id)
01637                 d->opd_syn_last_used_id = id;
01638         if (list_empty(&d->opd_syn_ontrack))
01639                 list_add(&d->opd_syn_ontrack, &tr->otr_wakeup_list);
01640         spin_unlock(&tr->otr_lock);
01641         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "new id %u\n", (unsigned) id);
01642 
01643         return id;
01644 }
01645 
01655 static void osp_sync_remove_from_tracker(struct osp_device *d)
01656 {
01657         struct osp_id_tracker *tr;
01658 
01659         tr = d->opd_syn_tracker;
01660         LASSERT(tr);
01661 
01662         if (list_empty(&d->opd_syn_ontrack))
01663                 return;
01664 
01665         spin_lock(&tr->otr_lock);
01666         list_del_init(&d->opd_syn_ontrack);
01667         spin_unlock(&tr->otr_lock);
01668 }
